concept.title: Cassandra
concept.shortdesc: The Cassandra destination writes data to a Cassandra cluster.

conbody.p: Cassandra destinationoverviewdestinationsCassandraWhen you configure the Cassandra destination, you define connection information, optional user credentials, and map incoming fields to columns in the Cassandra table.

Due to Cassandra requirements, the data types of the incoming fields must exactly match the types of the corresponding Cassandara columns. When appropriate, use a Type Converter processor earlier in the pipeline to convert the necessary data types.Batches written to Cassandra are atomic - that is, the entire batch of records is either successfully written to Cassandra, or fails. If an error occurs with one or more records in a batch, Cassandra fails the entire batch. When a batch fails, all records in the batch are processed based on the error handling configured for the Cassandra destination.
